sect2.title: Introduction to cracklib
sect2.para: The cracklib package contains a library used to enforce strong passwords by comparing user selected passwords to words in a chosen wordlist.

listitem.para: Estimated Disk space required (with cracklib wordlist): &cracklib-buildsize;

sect3.title: Additional downloads
sect3.para: You will also need to download a wordlist for use with cracklib. There are two wordlists to choose from at the following location. Use the cracklib word list for good security, or opt for the allwords word list for lightweight machines short on RAM. You can of course choose any other word list that you have at your disposal.

sect2.title: Installation of cracklib
sect2.para: First, we need to install the chosen word list for cracklib:

The wordlist is linked to /usr/share/dict/words as historically, words is the primary wordlist in the /usr/share/dict directory. We also echo the value of hostname to a file called extra.words. This extra file is intended to be a site specific list which includes easy to guess passwords such as company or department names, user's names, product names, computer names, domain names, etc.
